title: Failure-Based Language Learning Design: Strategic Error Utilization Course

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary language proficiency and mastery of job-related basic vocabulary
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing converting real workplace language errors into learning materials, targeting working professionals accessing content via mobile devices (smartphones) in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Analyzing linguistic failure cases in real business situations to develop at least three strategic response approaches
Reducing grammatical/vocabulary errors in business document writing by over 80% through intentional error generation-correction cycles
Identifying error patterns at least three times and proposing improvement measures using a feedback framework that evaluates peer learners' failure cases

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
